did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection primarily consists of personal correspondence between sea captain Charles Chadwick, his wife Mary Rowland Chadwick, and their daughter Mary Amelia Chadwick of Lyme, Connecticut. The letters were written while Charles was away at sea during the period 1828-1851. Also included are miscellaneous documents pertaining to ship and family business.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Charles Chadwick (September 9, 1803 - December 11, 1884) of Lyme, Connecticut sailed merchant ships as first mate from 1828-1845 and then as captain 1845-1851. He served as first mate on his elder brother Daniel Chadwick's packet ship "Wellington" several times. Charles married Mary Rowland (May 3, 1804 - May 14, 1875) on August 24, 1830. They had one daughter Mary Amelia (September 24, 1833 - February 10, 1863) and three sons. The Chadwick letters were written while Charles was away at sea and Mary maintained their house and farm in Lyme.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Gathered and arranged by Olive Tubbs Chendali, who was East Lyme historian and granddaughter of the Chadwicks, this collection provides interesting detail regarding both the life of a merchant sea captain and farm life in Connecticut in the nineteenth century. Of the 483 letters included, the majority (260) are from Charles, written while away on his voyages to Mary at their farm in Lyme, Connecticut, while 111 are from Mary to Charles, addressed to New York or London with the ship's name and/or in care of the ship owner's company, and 15 are from Amelia Chadwick to her father. An additional 95 letters were written either to or from Charles, Mary, and Amelia, or from other people. The collection also includes business papers and store receipts. The letters in the notebooks are copies and the originals are restricted for viewing.
Notebook 1: June 12, 1828 tbo Dec. 10, 1839. 103 letters with index of letters and a partial diagram of a packet ship.
Notebook 2: July 5, 1840 to Dec. 1 1845. 63 letters from Charles to Mary and index with dates of each letter.
Notebook 3: Jan 13, 1846 to Dec 31, 1847. 46 letters from Charles to Mary and index with dates of each letter.
Notebook 4: Jan 11, 1848 to Nov. 24, 1849. 30 letters from Charles to Mary and index with dates of each letter.
Notebook 5: Jan. 19, 1850 to Aug. 3, 1851. 20 letters from Charles to Mary and index with dates of each letter.
Notebook 6: 1829-1850. 111 letters from Mary to Charles and index with dates of each letter.

Notebook 7: 113 records of miscellaneous business and shipping papers, and receipts along with miscellaneous letters not to Charles' wife. This notebook also contains unsorted papers and deeds having to do with the family.
Notebook 8: 1845 to 1849. 15 letters from Mary Amelia, daughter of Mary and Charles, to family members.
Notebook 9: 1824-1838. Assorted papers and letters from Mary not to Charles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The letters are arranged in 9 notebooks.
